intro: Pasania falconeri, commonly known as the Falconeri's pasania, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Pasania falconeri is adapted to the arid and rocky environments of its native habitat.
